summary: The Checkpoint Modernization Act (H.R. 1861) mandates the renovation of U.S. Border Patrol checkpoints, prioritizing improvements to law enforcement safety, detection of illicit activities, and reduction of traffic congestion. It directs the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to submit reports and authorizes no less than $150 million annually from 2025-2028. Furthermore, it rescinds unobligated funds from the Inflation Reduction Act allocated to environmental and climate justice block grants.
